answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some information on places that use outsourcing for urban forestry jobs. 
This article discusses the many jobs which Augusta, GA outsources, including forestry services.
http://chronicle.augusta.com/news/government/2011-09-03/augusta-looks-more-services-privatize?v=1315097411
I have also included the Richmond, VA Department of Public Works Urban Forestry Division Audit Report which discusses instances where outsourcing work was the most cost effective option.
http://www.richmondgov.com/Auditor/documents/2010/10-07_PublicWorks_UrbanForestry.pdf
The State of Urban and Community Forestry in California created a report which includes a section on staffing and discusses outsourcing on page 17. 
http://www.ufei.org/files/ufeipubs/SUF03.pdf
I also found the Restructuring Committee Quarterly Report from Troy, MI which includes information about the different services they are considering outsourcing.
http://www.troymi.gov/EconomicSustainability/QuarterlyRestructuring/QuarterlyReport07202010.pdf
I also found the website of a landscaping company in IL which details the type of work it does for municipalities which may be helpful as a reference.
http://www.winklerstreeservice.com/municipalities.html
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Martin Lyons
text:
Evanston is a urban midwest community of 75,000, with a dense urban forest and a parks department as well.  We employee 20 individuals in our forestry division.  I would like to see any successful outsourcing initiatives that partially or totally outsourced the maintainance  and planting activities of a forestry division.
Need asap, and will take any documentation or links and finish the research myself.
Thanks
Marty Lyons
Asst. City Manager
Evanston
title: Outsourcing - forestry
